tuv.seg: How social welfare payments are paid
Athsholáthar leabhar leasa shóisialaigh nó Cárta Seirbhísí Sóisialacha
If you live in Ireland and are getting a social welfare payment, you can request the method by which you are paid
Má chónaíonn tú in Éirinn agus má tá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh á fáil agat, féadfaidh tú an modh a íoctar thú a iarraidh
• By Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT): your social welfare payment is paid directly into your personal account at a bank, building society or at certain credit unions
Cinntí riaracháin a bhíonn i gceist leis na cinntí a dhéantar ar an rogha modh íocaíochta laistigh den Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí
DSP will decide if you can be paid by EFT
• By cash in your local post office: you will need a Public Services Card or Social Services Card for identification to collect cash payments at your local post office
• Airgead i d’oifig poist áitiúil: Is féidir Cárta Seirbhísí Leasa Shóisialaigh (SWS) ar mhaithe le cúrsaí aitheantais a úsáid chun íocaíochtaí airgid a bhailiú ag d'oifig poist áitiúil
If using an SSC, you will also require photo ID
Cuirtear an Cárta Seirbhísí Poiblí in ionad an SWS
• By cheque: your social welfare payment cheque can be cashed in your local post office or lodged to an account in a financial institution
• Seic • Ríomhaistriú Airgid: íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a íoctar díreach isteach i do chuntas bainc
Social welfare payments are no longer paid using a book of payable orders that you can cash at your local post office
Ní íoctar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh trí leabhar pá-orduithe le briseadh ag d'oifig poist áitiúil a thuilleadh
